name: surveys
title: Surveys API
description: Creates and conducts surveys, lists the surveys that an authenticated user owns, and retrieves survey results and information about specified surveys.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

fields.name: singleLineResponse
fields.desc: Option to allow multiple line open text responses instead of a single line response. Note that we don't show auto-complete suggestions with multiple line responses.

fields.name: answers
fields.desc: Required list of answer options for a question.

fields.name: hasOther
fields.desc: Option to allow open-ended text box for Single Answer and Multiple Answer question types. This can be used with SINGLE_ANSWER, SINGLE_ANSWER_WITH_IMAGE, MULTIPLE_ANSWERS, and MULTIPLE_ANSWERS_WITH_IMAGE question types.

fields.name: highValueLabel
fields.desc: For rating questions, the text for the higher end of the scale, such as 'Best'. For numeric questions, a string representing a floating-point that is the maximum allowed number for a response.

fields.name: lowValueLabel
fields.desc: For rating questions, the text for the lower end of the scale, such as 'Worst'. For numeric questions, a string representing a floating-point that is the minimum allowed number for a response.

fields.name: videoId
fields.desc: The YouTube video ID to be show in video questions.

fields.name: openTextPlaceholder
fields.desc: Placeholder text for an open text question.

fields.name: question
fields.desc: Required question text shown to the respondent.

fields.name: sentimentText
fields.desc: Used by the Rating Scale with Text question type. This text goes along with the question field that is presented to the respondent, and is the actual text that the respondent is asked to rate.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: Required field defining the question type. For details about configuring different type of questions, consult the question configuration guide.

fields.name: answerOrder
fields.desc: The randomization option for multiple choice and multi-select questions. If not specified, this option defaults to randomize.

fields.name: lastAnswerPositionPinned
fields.desc: Currently only support pinning an answer option to the last position.

fields.name: mustPickSuggestion
fields.desc: Option to force the user to pick one of the open text suggestions. This requires that suggestions are provided for this question.

fields.name: numStars
fields.desc: Number of stars to use for ratings questions.

fields.name: openTextSuggestions
fields.desc: A list of suggested answers for open text question auto-complete. This is only valid if single_line_response is true.

fields.name: thresholdAnswers
fields.desc: The threshold/screener answer options, which will screen a user into the rest of the survey. These will be a subset of the answer option strings.

fields.name: unitOfMeasurementLabel
fields.desc: Optional unit of measurement for display (for example: hours, people, miles).

schemas.name: SurveyQuestionImage
schemas.desc: Container object for image data and alt_text.

fields.name: altText
fields.desc: The alt text property used in image tags is required for all images.

fields.name: data
fields.desc: Inline jpeg, gif, tiff, bmp, or png image raw bytes for an image question types.

fields.name: url
fields.desc: The read-only URL for the hosted images.

schemas.name: Survey
schemas.desc: Representation of an individual survey object.

fields.name: questions
fields.desc: List of questions defining the survey.

fields.name: rejectionReason
fields.desc: Reason for the survey being rejected. Only present if the survey state is rejected.

fields.name: state
fields.desc: State that the survey is in.

fields.name: audience
fields.desc: Targeting-criteria message containing demographic information

fields.name: cost
fields.desc: Cost to run the survey and collect the necessary number of responses.

fields.name: owners
fields.desc: List of email addresses for survey owners. Must contain at least the address of the user making the API call.

fields.name: title
fields.desc: Optional name that will be given to the survey.

fields.name: wantedResponseCount
fields.desc: Number of responses desired for the survey.

fields.name: customerData
fields.desc: Additional information to store on behalf of the API consumer and associate with this question. This binary blob is treated as opaque. This field is limited to 64K bytes.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: Text description of the survey.

fields.name: surveyUrlId
fields.desc: Unique survey ID, that is viewable in the URL of the Survey Creator UI

fields.name: maxCostPerResponseNanos
fields.desc: Threshold to start a survey automically if the quoted prices is less than or equal to this value. See Survey.Cost for more details.

schemas.name: MobileAppPanel
schemas.desc: Representation of an individual pre-defined panel object defining a targeted audience of opinion rewards mobile app users.

fields.name: owners
fields.desc: List of email addresses for users who can target members of this panel. Must contain at least the address of the user making the API call for panels that are not public. This field will be empty for public panels.

fields.name: country
fields.desc: Country code for the country of the users that the panel contains. Uses standard ISO 3166-1 2-character language codes. For instance, 'US' for the United States, and 'GB' for the United Kingdom. Any survey created targeting this panel must also target the corresponding country.

fields.name: isPublicPanel
fields.desc: Whether or not the panel is accessible to all API users.

fields.name: language
fields.desc: Language code that the panel can target. For instance, 'en-US'. Uses standard BCP47 language codes. See specification. Any survey created targeting this panel must also target the corresponding language.

fields.name: mobileAppPanelId
fields.desc: Unique panel ID string. This corresponds to the mobile_app_panel_id used in Survey Insert requests.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: Human readable name of the audience panel.

fields.name: requestId
fields.desc: Unique request ID used for logging and debugging. Please include in any error reporting or troubleshooting requests.

fields.name: resources
fields.desc: An individual predefined panel of Opinion Rewards mobile users.

fields.name: requestId
fields.desc: Unique request ID used for logging and debugging. Please include in any error reporting or troubleshooting requests.

fields.name: resources
fields.desc: An individual survey resource.

schemas.name: SurveyAudience
schemas.desc: Specifications for the target audience of a survey run through the API.

fields.name: populationSource
fields.desc: Online population source where the respondents are sampled from.

fields.name: ages
fields.desc: Optional list of age buckets to target. Supported age buckets are: ['18-24', '25-34', '35-44', '45-54', '55-64', '65+']

fields.name: country
fields.desc: Required country code that surveys should be targeted to. Accepts standard ISO 3166-1 2 character language codes. For instance, 'US' for the United States, and 'GB' for the United Kingdom.

fields.name: countrySubdivision
fields.desc: Country subdivision (states/provinces/etc) that surveys should be targeted to. For all countries except GB, ISO-3166-2 subdivision code is required (eg. 'US-OH' for Ohio, United States). For GB, NUTS 1 statistical region codes for the United Kingdom is required (eg. 'UK-UKC' for North East England).

fields.name: gender
fields.desc: Optional gender to target.

fields.name: languages
fields.desc: Language code that surveys should be targeted to. For instance, 'en-US'. Surveys may target bilingual users by specifying a list of language codes (for example, 'de' and 'en-US'). In that case, all languages will be used for targeting users but the survey content (which is displayed) must match the first language listed. Accepts standard BCP47 language codes. See specification.

fields.name: mobileAppPanelId
fields.desc: Key for predefined panel that causes survey to be sent to a predefined set of Opinion Rewards App users. You must set PopulationSource to ANDROID_APP_PANEL to use this field.

schemas.name: SurveyCost
schemas.desc: Message defining the cost to run a given survey through API.

fields.name: costPerResponseNanos
fields.desc: Cost per survey response in nano units of the given currency. To get the total cost for a survey, multiply this value by wanted_response_count.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.desc: Currency code that the cost is given in.

fields.name: maxCostPerResponseNanos
fields.desc: Threshold to start a survey automatically if the quoted price is at most this value. When a survey has a Screener (threshold) question, it must go through an incidence pricing test to determine the final cost per response. Typically you will have to make a followup call to start the survey giving the final computed cost per response. If the survey has no threshold_answers, setting this property will return an error. By specifying this property, you indicate the max price per response you are willing to pay in advance of the incidence test. If the price turns out to be lower than the specified value, the survey will begin immediately and you will be charged at the rate determined by the incidence pricing test. If the price turns out to be greater than the specified value the survey will not be started and you will instead be notified what price was determined by the incidence test. At that point, you must raise the value of this property to be greater than or equal to that cost before attempting to start the survey again. This will immediately start the survey as long the incidence test was run within the last 21 days.

fields.name: nanos
fields.desc: Cost of survey in nano units of the given currency. DEPRECATED in favor of cost_per_response_nanos

fields.name: requestId
fields.desc: Unique request ID used for logging and debugging. Please include in any error reporting or troubleshooting requests.

fields.name: resource
fields.desc: Survey object containing the specification of the started Survey.

fields.name: requestId
fields.desc: Unique request ID used for logging and debugging. Please include in any error reporting or troubleshooting requests.

fields.name: resource
fields.desc: Survey object containing the specification of the stopped Survey.

schemas.name: SurveyRejection
schemas.desc: Message representing why the survey was rejected from review, if it was.

fields.name: explanation
fields.desc: A human-readable explanation of what was wrong with the survey.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: Which category of rejection this was. See the  Google Surveys Help Center for additional details on each category.

schemas.name: SurveyResults
schemas.desc: Reference to the current results for a given survey.

fields.name: status
fields.desc: Human readable string describing the status of the request.

fields.name: surveyUrlId
fields.desc: External survey ID as viewable by survey owners in the editor view.

fields.name: requestId
fields.desc: Unique request ID used for logging and debugging. Please include in any error reporting or troubleshooting requests.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Retrieves a MobileAppPanel that is available to the authenticated user.

pathParams.name: panelId
pathParams.desc: External URL ID for the panel.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists the MobileAppPanels available to the authenticated user.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Updates a MobileAppPanel. Currently the only property that can be updated is the owners property.

pathParams.name: panelId
pathParams.desc: External URL ID for the panel.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Retrieves any survey results that have been produced so far. Results are formatted as an Excel file. You must add "?alt=media" to the URL as an argument to get results.

pathParams.name: surveyUrlId
pathParams.desc: External URL ID for the survey.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Lists the surveys owned by the authenticated user.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Updates a survey. Currently the only property that can be updated is the owners property.

pathParams.name: surveyUrlId
pathParams.desc: External URL ID for the survey.

methods.name: delete
methods.desc: Removes a survey from view in all user GET requests.

pathParams.name: surveyUrlId
pathParams.desc: External URL ID for the survey.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Retrieves information about the specified survey.

pathParams.name: surveyUrlId
pathParams.desc: External URL ID for the survey.
